Function Documentation

static int _faceBlob_compare ( const void *  node1,
const void *  node2 
) [static]

Compare two faces.

Description:

To be used in this file (mesh.c) only for comparing faces. Expects faces to already be sorted so that smallest node ID is first and 2nd smallest vertex ID is next. (The order of the last 1 or 2 vertices is set by PATRAN ordering conventions.)

This method returns -1 if the first face's vertex IDs are smaller than the 2nd face's, 0 if the faces are the same; and 1 if the first face's vertex IDs are greater than the 2nd's.

Note, only the 1st 3 vertices are compared. In well behaved meshes, this should be suffient to compare faces. (I.e. we are assuming that quads will share 1, 2 or 4 vertices, but never just 3--if 3 are the same, all 4 will be the same. We are also assuming that tris will not be "inside a quad" and therefore share 3 vertices.)

Modifications:

  • 10/10/2005 WSD. Promoted. Used to be inside _fc_buildFaces() but static functions not allowed inside funtions in gcc 4.0.

05214         return -1;
05215       else if (faceNode1->vertexIDs[2] > faceNode2->vertexIDs[2])
05216         return 1;
05217       else 
05218         return 0;
05219     }
05220   }

FC_ReturnCode _fc_buildEdgeConns ( FC_Mesh  mesh  ) 

Build the edge info for the mesh.

Description:

Finds the unique list of edges for the given set of elements. It also adds edgeIDs arrays to each element.

Assumes that all elements are the same type.

Modifications:

  • Wendy Koegler 4/02 Created
  • 02/06/04 WSK, changed to return raw data arrays too.
  • 07/09/04 WSK, added building of upward and downward connections to vertices and elements (so could get rid of _fc_guildUpwardsConns).
Parameters:
mesh  The mesh to build stuff on.

05128       }

05130     }
05131   }
05132   
05133   // now build the edgeConns & edges array by walking array of edge lists
05134   edgeConns = malloc(2*numEdge*sizeof(int));
05135   if (edgeConns == NULL) {
05136     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));

05138   }

05142       temp_ID = edgeBlob->edgeID;
05143       edgeConns[2*temp_ID] = i;
05144       edgeConns[2*temp_ID + 1] = edgeBlob->endVert;
05145       free(edgeBlob);
05146     }
05147     fc_freeSortedBlobArray(&edgeLists[i]);
05148   }

05150

05154   meshSlot->elemToEdgeConns = elemToEdgeConns;
05155 
05156   return FC_SUCCESS;
05157 }

FC_ReturnCode _fc_buildFaceConns ( FC_Mesh  mesh  ) 

Build the face info for the mesh.

Description:

Finds the unique list of faces for the given set of elements. It also adds faceIDs arrays to each element. The vertices in each face are ordered so that the "smallest" edge is first. That is, the smallest ID is first, then the edge from that vertex that has the smaller 2nd ID is next.

Assumes that if comparing first 3 vertices of two face and they are the same, it is the same face (follows from assuming planar faces or some kind of well behaved mesh).

When the face type is FC_ET_MIXED (i.e. mix of triangles and quads for pyramid and prism meshes), the returned connectivity array will be of the size numFace*maxNumVertPerFace and for faces that have fewer vertices than maxNumVertPerFace, the remaining entries for that face will have values of -1. Although this takes up more space, this organization makes it easier to index to a particular face.

Todo:
Make it so that unique faces will have orient of 1 in their element.
Modifications:
  • 02/03/04 WSK, Created
  • 02/06/04 WSK, changed to return raw data arrays too.
  • 07/09/04 WSK, added building of upward and downward connections to vertices and elements (so could get rid of _fc_guildUpwardsConns).
Parameters:
mesh  The mesh to build stuff on.

05397       if (temp_vertexIDs[idx + 1] < temp_vertexIDs[idx + numVertexID - 1]) {        
05398         elemFaceOrients[i*numFacePerElem+j] = 1;
05399         for (k = 0; k < numVertexID; k++)
05400           tempFaceBlob.vertexIDs[k] = temp_vertexIDs[k+idx];
05401       }
05402       else {
05403         elemFaceOrients[i*numFacePerElem+j] = -1;
05404         tempFaceBlob.vertexIDs[0] = temp_vertexIDs[idx];
05405         for (k = 1; k < numVertexID; k++)
05406           tempFaceBlob.vertexIDs[k] = temp_vertexIDs[idx + numVertexID - k];
05407       }
05408 
05409       // look for entry in faceLists based on first vertex
05410       _fc_lookupBlobInSortedBlobArray(&faceLists[tempFaceBlob.vertexIDs[0]],
05411                           &tempFaceBlob, _faceBlob_compare,
05412                           &foundBlob, &blobIdx);
05413       if (foundBlob) {
05414      faceBlob = faceLists[tempFaceBlob.vertexIDs[0]].blobs[blobIdx];
05415       }
05416       else { // make a new face
05417      faceBlob = (_FaceBlob*)malloc(sizeof(_FaceBlob));
05418      if (faceBlob == NULL) {
05419        fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
05420           return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
05421      }
05422      *faceBlob = tempFaceBlob; // check me!
05423         faceBlob->faceID = numFace;
05424      _fc_addEntryToSortedBlobArray(&faceLists[tempFaceBlob.vertexIDs[0]],
05425                           blobIdx, faceBlob);
05426         numFace++;
05427       }
05428       elemToFaceConns[i*numFacePerElem+j] = faceBlob->faceID;
05429     }
05430   }
05431 
05432   // now build the faceTypes, numVertPerFace, faceConns and faces arrays by walking array
05433   // of face lists
05434   faceType = fc_getElementTypeFaceType(elemType);
05435   maxNumVertPerFace = fc_getElementTypeNumVertex(faceType);
05436   if (maxNumVertPerFace < 0 && faceType == FC_ET_MIXED)
05437     maxNumVertPerFace = 4; // only pyramids & prisms have mixed face type
05438   faceTypes = malloc(numFace*sizeof(FC_ElementType));
05439   numVertPerFace = malloc(numFace*sizeof(int));
05440   faceConns = malloc(numFace*maxNumVertPerFace*sizeof(int));
05441   if (faceTypes == NULL || numVertPerFace == NULL || faceConns == NULL) {
05442     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
05443     free(faceTypes);
05444     free(numVertPerFace);
05445     free(faceConns);
05446     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
05447   }
05448   for (i = 0; i < numVertex; i++) {
05449     for (j = 0; j < faceLists[i].numBlob; j++) {
05450       faceBlob = (_FaceBlob*)faceLists[i].blobs[j];
05451       temp_ID = faceBlob->faceID;
05452       faceTypes[temp_ID] = faceBlob->faceType;
05453       numVertPerFace[temp_ID] = faceBlob->numVertex;
05454       memcpy(&faceConns[maxNumVertPerFace*temp_ID], faceBlob->vertexIDs,
05455              faceBlob->numVertex*sizeof(int));
05456       for (k = faceBlob->numVertex; k < maxNumVertPerFace; k++)
05457         faceConns[maxNumVertPerFace*temp_ID + k] = -1;
05458       free(faceBlob);
05459     }
05460     fc_freeSortedBlobArray(&faceLists[i]);
05461   } 
05462   free(faceLists);
05463 
05464   // set output
05465   meshSlot->numFace = numFace;
05466   meshSlot->faceTypes = faceTypes;
05467   meshSlot->numVertPerFace = numVertPerFace;
05468   meshSlot->faceToVertConns = faceConns;
05469   meshSlot->elemToFaceConns = elemToFaceConns;
05470   meshSlot->elemFaceOrients = elemFaceOrients;
05471 
05472   return FC_SUCCESS;
05473 }

FC_ReturnCode _fc_buildMeshElementNeighborsViaEntity ( FC_Mesh  mesh,
FC_AssociationType  sharedType 
)

Build element neighbors that share the specified entity type.

Description:

Computes the big data arrays that store number of element neighbors per element and the ids of those neighbors.

This is a helper and should only be called internally. It doesn't have robust checking.

Modifications:

  • 10/31/2005 WSD. Created to replace _fc_buildElementNeighbors. Since the code is essentially the same for three possible share entity types, replace 3 specific versions with 1 general one.

05976      free(meshSlotp->seqSubIDs[i]);
05977       free(meshSlotp->seqSubIDs);
05978     }
05979     if (meshSlotp->basicVarIDs)
05980       free(meshSlotp->basicVarIDs);
05981     if (meshSlotp->numStepPerSeqVar)
05982       free(meshSlotp->numStepPerSeqVar);
05983     if (meshSlotp->seqVarIDs) {
05984       for (i = 0; i < meshSlotp->numSeqVar; i++)
05985      free(meshSlotp->seqVarIDs[i]);
05986       free(meshSlotp->seqVarIDs);
05987     }
05988 
05989     // clear table header
05990     _fc_clearSlotHeader(&meshSlotp->header);
05991 
05992     // reinit
05993     _fc_initMeshSlot(meshSlotp);
05994   }
05995 }

FC_ReturnCode _fc_getMeshEdgeParentsOfVerticesPtr ( FC_Mesh  mesh,
int **  numEdgePerVert,
int ***  edgeParentsPerVert 
)

Return parent edges of the vertices.

Description:

This routine returns pointers to two arrays which hold the number of parent edges for each vertex and the IDs of the parent edges for each vertex. The array with the edge IDs is a 2D array. Each vertex's edge parent IDs are in sorted order. Get an edge parent ID by

edgeParentsPerVert[VertID][i];

where i is 0 ... numEdgePerVert[vertID] - 1. These are big data arrays and should NOT be freed by the calling program.

Note that edges may not yet exist for the mesh, and if they don't, calling this function will build them (which may take some time).

Also note that if there cannot be any edges on the mesh (only happens for point meshes), NULLs will be returned instead of arrays.

Modifications:

  • 10/27/05 WSD, created.
Parameters:
mesh  input - mesh
numEdgePerVert  output - array of number of edge parents per vertex
edgeParentsPerVert  output - array of arrays of edge parent IDs, treat read only

Definition at line 4250 of file mesh.c.

References _fc_buildParents(), _fc_getMeshSlot(), _FC_MeshSlot::edgeParentsPerVert, FC_AT_EDGE, FC_AT_VERTEX, fc_getReturnCodeText(), FC_INPUT_ERROR, fc_printfErrorMessage, fc_printfLogMessage, FC_SUCCESS, _FC_MeshSlot::header, _FC_SlotHeader::name, _FC_MeshSlot::numEdge, and _FC_MeshSlot::numEdgePerVert.

Referenced by _fc_getEdgeNeighbors(), and _fc_getVertexParents().

04256   {
04257   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04258   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
04259   
04260   // default return
04261   if (numEdgePerVert)
04262     *numEdgePerVert = NULL;
04263   if (edgeParentsPerVert)
04264     *edgeParentsPerVert = NULL;
04265 
04266   // check input
04267   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
04268   if (meshSlot == NULL || numEdgePerVert == NULL ||
04269       edgeParentsPerVert == NULL) {
04270     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04271     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04272   }
04273   
04274   // log message
04275   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting parent edges of the vertices on mesh '%s'", 
04276                       meshSlot->header.name);
04277 
04278   // if it doesn't exist, build stuff
04279   if (meshSlot->numEdge < 0 || 
04280       (meshSlot->numEdge > 0 && meshSlot->numEdgePerVert == NULL)) {
04281     rc = _fc_buildParents(mesh, FC_AT_VERTEX, FC_AT_EDGE);
04282     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04283       return rc;
04284   }
04285 
04286   // return pointers
04287   *numEdgePerVert = meshSlot->numEdgePerVert;
04288   *edgeParentsPerVert = meshSlot->edgeParentsPerVert;
04289   
04290   return FC_SUCCESS;
04291 }

_FC_MeshSlot* _fc_getMeshSlot ( FC_Mesh  mesh  ) 

Get a mesh slot from a mesh handle.

Description:

The slot id of the mesh handle is used to find the the slot in the mesh table. The identity is then verified by checking that the slot and the handle's uIDs are the same. On success, a pointer to the slot is returned. Otherwise a NULL pointer is returned.

Modifications:

  • 2003-OCT-19 WSK Created to replace using _fc_checkhandle and GET_ID for better type checking (using pointer's to slots is less bug prone than lot's of xxxTable[xxxID] references).
  • 05/25/04 WSK Changed to call new _fc_isHandleValid common to all tables.
Parameters:
mesh  input - mesh

Definition at line 6054 of file mesh.c.

_FC_MeshSlot* _fc_getMeshSlotFromID ( int  meshID  ) 

Get a mesh slot based on ID.

Description:

The _FC_MeshSlot at the requested slotID is returned. This should only be used when you really know that it is the slot you want because there is no checking of the uID like with _fc_getMeshSlot. The only checking is that the slotID is exists in the table and that the uID is > 0 (i.e. it is not empty).

Modifications:

  • 11/27/03 WSK Created so that external routines can index into tables without knowing about them.
  • 05/25/04 WSK Changed to call new _fc_getSlot() common to all tables.

FC_ReturnCode _fc_getMeshVertexNeighborsViaEdgePtr ( FC_Mesh  mesh,
int **  numVertNeighsViaEdge,
int ***  vertNeighsViaEdge 
)

Return vertex neighbors that share an edge.

Description:

This routine returns pointers to two arrays which hold the number of vertex neighbors for each vertex and the IDs of the vertex neighbors for each vertex. The array with the vertex IDs is a 2D array. Each vert's neighbor IDs are in sorted order. Get an vetex neighbor ID by

vertNeighsViaEdge[vertID][i];

where i is 0 ... numVertNeighsViaEdge[vertID] - 1. These are big data arrays and should NOT be freed by the calling program.

Note that edges may not yet exist for the mesh, and if they don't, calling this function will build them (which may take some time).

Also note that if there cannot be any edges on the mesh (only happens for point meshes), NULLs will be returned instead of arrays.

Modifications:

  • 10/31/05 WSD, created.
Parameters:
mesh  input - mesh
numVertNeighsViaEdge  output - array of number of vert neighbors per vert (that share an edge)
vertNeighsViaEdge  output - array of arrays of vert neighbor IDs, treat read only

05852   }

05856     free(meshSlotp->edgeParentsPerVert);

05868   }

05878   }

05882   }
05883   if (meshSlotp->elemParentsPerEdge) {
05884     for (i = 0; i < meshSlotp->numEdge; i++)
05885       free(meshSlotp->elemParentsPerEdge[i]);
05886     free(meshSlotp->elemParentsPerEdge);
05887     meshSlotp->elemParentsPerEdge = NULL;
05888   }
05889    if (meshSlotp->numElemPerFace) {
05890     free(meshSlotp->numElemPerFace);
05891     meshSlotp->numElemPerFace = NULL;
05892   }
05893   if (meshSlotp->elemParentsPerFace) {
05894     for (i = 0; i < meshSlotp->numFace; i++)

05896     free(meshSlotp->elemParentsPerFace);
05897     meshSlotp->elemParentsPerFace = NULL;
05898   }
05899   //---
05900   if (meshSlotp->numVertNeighsViaEdge) {

05902     meshSlotp->numVertNeighsViaEdge = NULL;
05903   }
05904   if (meshSlotp->vertNeighsViaEdge) {

05906       free(meshSlotp->vertNeighsViaEdge[i]);
05907     free(meshSlotp->vertNeighsViaEdge);

05909   }
05910   if (meshSlotp->numElemNeighsViaVert) {
05911     free(meshSlotp->numElemNeighsViaVert);
05912     meshSlotp->numElemNeighsViaVert = NULL;
05913   }
05914   if (meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaVert) {
05915     for (i = 0; i < meshSlotp->numElement; i++)
05916       free(meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaVert[i]);
05917     free(meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaVert);
05918     meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaVert = NULL;
05919   }
05920   if (meshSlotp->numElemNeighsViaEdge) {

05927     free(meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaEdge);

05929   }
05930   if (meshSlotp->numElemNeighsViaFace) {
05931     free(meshSlotp->numElemNeighsViaFace);
05932     meshSlotp->numElemNeighsViaFace = NULL;
05933   }
05934   if (meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaFace) {
05935     for (i = 0; i < meshSlotp->numElement; i++)
05936       free(meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaFace[i]);
05937     free(meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaFace);
05938     meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaFace = NULL;
05939   }
05940 
05941   //---
05942   meshSlotp->numEdge = -1;
05943   meshSlotp->numFace = -1;
05944   
05945   return;
05946 }

FC_ReturnCode _fc_setSphereCoords ( int  numVerts,
FC_Coords  center,
double  radius,
double *  coords 
)

Set coordinates for a sphere mesh.

Description:

This function creates a spehere mesh.

Note: numVerts must equal sqrt((numVerts-2)^2)+2 Note: the user supplies the coords array. This function just fills it in (no boundary checks are performed)

Modifications:

  • 04/08/2008 CDU Created
Parameters:
numVerts  Input - the number of vertices that describe the sphere.
center  Input - coordinate for where sphere's center is located
radius  Input - the radius of the spehere
coords  Output - the pre-allocated array that holds the vertex coordinates

Referenced by fc_createSphereMesh(), and fc_setSphereDisplacementVariable().

01901   //Work your way down all of the planes and all the circles
01902   place =0;
01903   phi  =180.0/(double)(numPlane+1);
01904   theta=360.0/(double)numPlane;
01905   for(zcount=1; zcount<=numPlane; zcount++){
01906     double zplane = cos((double)zcount*phi*toRad);
01907     for(i=0;i<numPlane; i++){

01910       coords[place*numDim+1] = center[1] + radius*(r*sin(theta*(double)i*toRad));
01911       coords[place*numDim+2] = center[2] + radius*zplane;

01915     }
01916   }

01919   coords[place*numDim+1] = center[1] + 0.0;
01920   coords[place*numDim+2] = center[2] + radius;
01921   place++;
01922 
01923   //Bottom

01925   coords[place*numDim+1] = center[1] + 0.0;
01926   coords[place*numDim+2] = center[2] - radius;
01927   place++;
01928 
01929   return FC_SUCCESS;
